abstractText: The Vasudhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka is a hymn in praise to Vasudhārā, a Buddhist deity of wealth and abundance, composed of one hundred and eight epithets. This hymn is often found in the Saptavāra collection in the place of the Vasudhāradhāraṇī (see, for instance, MS Add.1315 and MS Add.1356). The paper manuscript has a very orderly and well planned layout and seems to belong to a collection consisting of all the items under the shelfmark Or.1814.

title: Vasudhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka
